full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 747 Filed 08/10/22 Page 190 of 228 866 LC2VMAX6 Alessi - Direct

1 THE COURT: I understand.
2 I'm going to overrule the objection. Go ahead.
3 Q. Would you please look through the exhibit and let us know if you see Sarah Kellen's name in the exhibit?
4 A. Can you repeat the name?
5 Q. Sarah Kellen.
6 THE COURT: Actually, do you know what? I'll ask you to pause, Mr. Alessi. I'll sustain the objection. I think it's lost the thread on authentication at this point. You'll go to the question that I asked you to.
7 MS. COMEY: Your Honor, I'm sorry. Now I'm confused.
8 THE COURT: The earlier foundation objection that I asked you to return to.
9 MS. COMEY: Yes, your Honor.
10 May I have a moment?
11 THE COURT: You may.
12 (Counsel conferred)
13 BY MS. COMEY:
14 Q. So Mr. Alessi --
15 Q. -- how do you know that this Government Exhibit 52 is a later version of the directory that you saw when you worked for Mr. Epstein?
16 A. I think this is a later version. In the back page of the front cover it says 2004-2005.
17 SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300
18 DOJ-OGR-00012475

Would you please look through the exhibit and let us know if you see Sarah Kellen's name in the exhibit? A. Can you repeat the name? Q. Sarah Kellen. THE COURT: Actually, do you know what? I'll ask you to pause, Mr. Alessi. I'll sustain the objection. I think it's lost the thread on authentication at this point. You'll go to the question that I asked you to. MS. COMEY: Your Honor, I'm sorry. Now I'm confused. THE COURT: The earlier foundation objection that I asked you to return to. MS. COMEY: Yes, your Honor. May I have a moment? THE COURT: You may. (Counsel conferred) BY MS. COMEY: Q. So Mr. Alessi -- Q. -- how do you know that this Government Exhibit 52 is a later version of the directory that you saw when you worked for Mr. Epstein? A. I think this is a later version. In the back page of the front cover it says 2004-2005.

additional_notes: The document is a court transcript with a clear and legible format. There are no visible redactions or damage.
